header.abstract: The Kentucky Utilities records (dated 1933-2009; 8 cubic feet; 12 boxes) primarily comprise reports, newsletters, and scrapbooks that document the history and operations of Kentucky Utilities in Lexington, Kentucky.

descriptive_summary.author: Madeline Alvey, Logan McGuire
descriptive_summary.title: Kentucky Utilities records
descriptive_summary.arrangement: Collection is arranged by format in three series: Annual reports 1933-2009, Kentucky Utilities Employee's Newsletters 1944-1998, and Scrapbooks 1949-1973.
descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2018ms010 : [identification of item], Kentucky Utilities records, 1933-2009, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Kentucky Utilities (KU) started services on December 2, 1912. In 1998, KU was acquired by Louisville Gas and Electric Company (LGamp;E). As of 2010 LG&E and KU Energy, a litmited liability company is owned by Pennsylvania Power & Light Company (PPL). Kentucky Utilities was founded to serve five areas of Kentucky and has grown to serve 77 Kentucky counties and five Virginia counties. At its beginning, KU provided a variety of services to customers, including deliviries of ice; now it primarily offers coal and dam generated electricity. Since 1999 LG&E and KU Energy has investment in power companies throughout the world, including in Argentina, Spain, and Germany.

Sources: Corporate History, LG&E and KU Energy, https://lge-ku.com/our-company#c-overlay, accessed 2021 February 2. Kentucky Utilities, Wikipedia, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kentucky_Utilities, accessed 2021 February 2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Kentucky Utilities records (dated 1933-2009; 8 cubic feet; 12 boxes) primarily comprise reports, newsletters, and scrapbooks that document the history and operations of Kentucky Utilities in Lexington, Kentucky. The collection also includes a scrapbook documenting community events in Lexington from 1949-1950. The newsletters consist of employee newsletters sharing information about the individual workers of Kentucky Utilities from 1944-1998.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Kentucky Utilities Employee's News (dated 1944-1998; 2 cubic feet; 2 boxes) primarily comprise of bound newsletters that document the lives and accomplishments surrounding the workers of Kentucky Utilities in Lexington, Kentucky.
